definitions.definition: An utterance or gesture expressing greeting or honor towards someone, now especially a formal, non-verbal gesture made with the arms or hands in any of various specific positions.
definitions.example: The soldiers greeted the dignitaries with a crisp salute.

definitions.definition: A discharge of cannon or similar arms, as a mark of honour or respect.
A pyrotechnic device primarily designed to produce a loud bang.
To make a gesture in honor of (someone or something).
definitions.example: They saluted the flag as it passed in the parade.

definitions.definition: To act in thanks, honor, or tribute; to thank or extend gratitude; to praise.
definitions.example: I would like to salute the many dedicated volunteers that make this project possible.

definitions.definition: To wave, to acknowledge an acquaintance.
definitions.example: I saluted Bill at the concert, but he didn't see me through the crowd.

definitions.definition: To address, as with expressions of kind wishes and courtesy; to greet; to hail.
To promote the welfare and safety of; to benefit; to gratify.
